Description.div:
The Item to be modified. Pass the ItemKey attribute or the combination of OrganizationCode, ItemID, and UnitOfMeasure to identify the Item.
Must pass either ItemKey attribute or the combination of OrganizationCode, ItemID, and UnitOfMeasure.
Values passed are invalid, and do not identify an item.
Try to modify the ItemID, OrganizationCode, or UnitOfMeasure attributes.
Try to delete an item that still has inventory in the system.
Try to create a service item with a different UnitOfMeasure but with ItemID that already exits.
Try to modify item with an EffectiveStartDate or EffectiveEndDate and a circular association relationship.
Try to modify item with an EffectiveStartDate or EffectiveEndDate and multiple association relationships.
If SubCatalogOrganizationCode is not of a valid sub-catalog organization of the catalog organization specified in OrganziationCode field:
If UnitOfMeasure is not configured in the system.

Action to take
Valid Values:
Manage - Creates a new record if it does not exist, or modifies an existing record if it does.
Create - Creates a new record.
Modify - Change values in an existing record.
Delete - Deletes an existing record.
The default behavior is Manage .

If AssociateItemToCategories is passed as Y during item creation, item and category list, association is made. When category details are mentioned within an Item tag(<Item><CategoryList><Category CategoryID="" CategoryPath=""/><CategoryList/><Item/>),only the relevant categories and item are associated, else item is associated with all categories which are part of the same organization code
If CheckInventoryBeforeDelete is passed as N, check for inventory is skipped. By default value for CheckInventoryBeforeDelete is Y.
Unique global identifier used to cross reference an item.

This field indicates whether the item is a Product or Provided Service or Provided Service Option or Delivery Service or Delivery Service Option.
Default: PROD - Product
Valid Values:
PROD - Product
PS - Provided Service
DS - Delivery Service
SS - Special Service
PSOPT - Provided Service Option
DSOPT - Delivery Service Option
Try to modify the ItemGroupCode attribute.
Value of this attribute cannot be PS or DS if KitCode is bundle.
The timestamp the item was synchronized with an external system. If attribute is passed in the input without a value, the attribute will be updated to current timestamp.

The unit of measure for item quantity.
UnitOfMeasure is empty for Special Service item.
If UnitOfMeasure is non empty for SS item.

The BOM XML used to define a preconfigured item.
BOMXML and Components are passed to create the item.
Item must be preconfigured in order to pass BOMXML.
If item component in BOMXML is a kit, it must be a preconfigured item.

This field indicates the way bundle will be fulfilled. It can be Ship Together(01), Ship Independent(00), or Deliver Together(02). Default value is Ship Together(01).
BundleFulfillmentMode cannot be other than 00, 01, or 02.

This field determines how the capacity quantity is arrived at for provided and delivery services from the inventory quantity. Valid values: ORD - Based on the ordered service quantity; ASSOC - Based on the service and product association. Default value: ORD.
Valid CapacityQuantityStrategy value for Special Service item is ORD

The model name of the configurable item.
ConfigurationModelName is set for an item that is not configurable.

This flag indicates that the item is a configurable item. A configurable item can either be a bundle or a physical kit. A configurable bundle item offers a number of different options from which a customer can select before buying the product. Components for a bundle are not specified in the catalog as the actual components will be determined by the user when an order is placed. A physical kit must always be pre-configured.
IsConfigurable is passed as Y and KitCode is not BUNDLE or PK .
IsConfigurable is passed as Y and ConfiguredModelKey is not passed.
IsConfigurable is passed as Y and KitCode is PK but IsPreConfigured is N .

This flag indicates that the item is an item with variations (formerly known as a model item). An item with variations represents a group of items with similar set of attributes.
An item with variations is a child of another item with variations.
An item with variations is a logical kit, a bundle, or a dynamic physical kit.

This flag indicates that the configurable item is pre-configured with selected options. If a bundle is pre-configured, the bundle or physical components that represent the selected option will be available in the catalog. For a pre-configured physical kit, only the physical kit will be available as the item in the catalog.
IsPreConfigured is passed as Y and IsConfigurable is not Y .

Indicates if during scheduling an order, supersession is allowed or not. If passed as Y , schedule will automatically attempt to substitute an item with preferred or regular substitute.
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N
If IsSubOnOrderAllowed is passed as Y and item is a kit item, it must be a physical kit.

The master catalog ID to which this item belongs.
Must be a valid MasterCatalogId for the passed OrganizationCode.
MasterCatalogId is provided and item is delivery or service item.
The pricing unit of measure, if different from the inventory unit of measure. PricingUOM should be passed if pricing is maintainted.

This field determines how the pricing unit of measure is defaulted for the item. It could be same as the inventory UOM or could be different. PricingUOMStrategy should be passed if pricing is maintainted.
Valid Values:
Value
Meaning
INV
Pricing unit of measure is the same as inventory unit of measure.
ALT
Pricing unit of measure is different than inventory unit of measure.

Unit of measure in which item height is measured.
An invalid dimension unit of measure is passed.

Unit of measure in which item length is measured.
An invalid dimension unit of measure is passed.

Unit of measure in which item width is measured.
An invalid dimension unit of measure is passed.

Inventory related parameters.
If both OnhandSafetyFactorQuantity and OnhandSafetyFactorPercentage are provided.

The future safety factor percentage of this item. The FutureSafetyFactorPercentage will be excluded from the actual future availability of the item if the scheduling rule, node type, and supply type are configured to apply future safety factor.
If FutureSafetyFactorPercentage is not between 0 to 100.

The on-hand safety factor percentage of this item. The OnhandSafetyFactorPercentage will be excluded from the actual on-hand availability of the item if the scheduling rule, node type, and supply type are configured to apply on-hand safety factor.
If OnhandSafetyFactorPercentage is not between 0 to 100.

Used to indicate if item is tag controlled. Inventory module uses this flag to determine if additional inventory attributes need to be stored for the item
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N or S
S - Sometimes - Inventory does not mandate tag details.
If this is passed as Y then InventoryTagAttributes element must be passed.

Indicates if the item is time sensitive.
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N
If Reset is passed as Y , the old safety factor defn records are removed and replaced with the new ones. If Reset is not passed or Reset is passed as N , only the deltas are applied.
Valid value areSHP, PICK or DEL.

The FutureSafetyFactorPercentage will be excluded from the actual future availability of the item if the scheduling rule, node type, and supply type are configured to apply future safety factor.
If FutureSafetyFactorPercentage is not between 0 to 100.

The OnhandSafetyFactorPercentage will be excluded from the actual on-hand availability of the item if the scheduling rule, node type, and supply type are configured to apply on-hand safety factor.
If OnhandSafetyFactorPercentage is not between 0 to 100.
Valid value are Create, Modify and Delete.

This field describes the identifier of the item with variations to which this item belongs. The unique identifier is the combination of Model and ModelItemUnitOfMeasure.
If item is assigned to different categories than the item with variations to which it belongs
If Reset is passed as Y , the old item aliases are removed and replaced with the new ones. If Reset is not passed or Reset is passed as N , only the deltas are applied.

Action to take. Valid values are Modify , and Delete . Set to Modify to modify the contents of the item alias. Set to Delete to delete the item alias from YFS_ITEM_ALIAS table. Default value is Modify .
If Reset is passed as Y , the old item service skills are removed and replaced with the new ones. If Reset is not passed or Reset is passed as N , only the deltas are applied.

Optional. Valid for only for service items. This table is used to store the service skills needed to provide a service.
If this element is passed, ServiceSkillId attribute cannot be blank.
If this element is passed, ServiceSkillId attribute should be the identifier of a valid service skill created for the organization for which item is being modified.
This element can be passed only for service items.
Valid value is Delete . Set Operation = " Delete " to delete the entity.
If Reset is passed as Y , the old item options are removed and replaced with the new ones. If Reset is not passed or Reset is passed as N , only the deltas are applied.

Options for an provided service or delivery service item.
Invalid information item information is passed for option.
Valid value is Delete . Set Operation = " Delete " to delete the entity.
If Reset is passed as Y , the old information is removed and replaced with the new information. If Reset is not passed or Reset is passed as N , only the deltas are applied.
Valid value is Delete . Set Operation = " Delete " to delete the entity.
If Reset is passed as Y , the old information is removed and replaced with the new information. If Reset is not passed or Reset is passed as N , only the deltas are applied.

Optional. This table is used to store the service skills needed to provide the service for the product item being created.
If this element is passed, ServiceSkillId attribute cannot be blank.
If this element is passed, ServiceSkillId attribute should be the identifier of a valid service skill created for the organization for which item is being created.
Valid value is Delete . Set Operation = " Delete " to delete the entity.
If Reset is passed as Y , the old information is removed and replaced with the new information. If Reset is not passed or Reset is passed as N , only the deltas are applied.

Alternate UOM for an item.
An invalid dimension unit of measure is passed for LengthUOM, WeightUOM, or HeightUOM.
Valid value is Delete . Set Operation = " Delete " to delete the entity.
If Reset is passed as Y , the old item instructions are removed and replaced with the new ones. If Reset is not passed or Reset is passed as N , only the deltas are applied.

Stores instructions pertaining to the item. Standard pre-defined instruction code as defined by the catalog organization can be used as the value of InstructionCode. Free form instruction text for the given instruction type can be used as the value of InstructionText.

Standard pre-defined instruction code as defined by the catalog organization. If passed, it will be validated against configuration and InstructionText will be ignored. InstructionText is used whenever InstructionCode is not passed.
Invalid item instruction code.
Valid value is Delete . Set Operation = " Delete " to delete the entity.
If Reset is passed as Y , the old records are removed and replaced with the new ones. If Reset is not passed or Reset is passed as N , only the deltas are applied.

This entity is used to store values for an attribute assigned to a category or item. This entity is also used to store dynamic attributes attached with an entity. Currently used to store additional attributes for item and category entities.
If this element is passed, Name attribute cannot be blank.
If this element is passed, either Value or IntegerValue or DoubleValue must be passed.
An AdditionalAttribute record is not allowed for an Attribute record that has an AttributeReference associated to it.
If the associated Attribute record is configured with AllowMultipleValues as 'N', then only one AdditionalAttribute record is allowed for that Attribute for the associated item or category of this AdditionalAttribute record.
If the associated Attribute record is of DataType 'TEXT' and is configured with an AllowedValueLength and the flag IsAllowedValueDefined is not set to 'Y', then the length of this Value attribute may not exceed the defined AllowedValueLength.
If this AdditionalAttribute record is associated to an Attribute record and the flag IsAllowedValueDefined is set to 'Y', then either Value or IntegerValue or DoubleValue must be one of the computed values from the AttributeAllowedValue record.

Operation to perform
Valid Values:
Manage - Creates a new record if it does not exist, or modifies an existing record if it does.
Create - Creates a new record.
Modify - Change values in an existing record.
Delete - Deletes an existing record.
The default behavior is Manage .
If the value of Reset passed is Y , the component definitions are changed. If the value of Reset passed is N , only the deltas are applied.

This element defines a component of the Item, if it is a Kit Item. To identify a component, pass either ComponentItemKey or ComponentItemID, ComponentOrganizationCode, and ComponentUnitOfMeasure is required.
Try to add a ComponentItem that cannot be identified in the database.
If kitCode is Nonbundle then component cannot be Bundle.
Item already exist in hierarchy.
Component item is not PS or PROD and parent item is bundle.
Bundle component is DPK.
KitCode is missing when item components are provided in the input.
One or more bundle components did not meet item validation criteria.
KitCode is passed as a fractional value.

Attribute.Name: ComponentItemID
Attribute.Description: Along with ComponentOrganizationCode and ComponentUnitOfMeasure, it identifies a component item.

Attribute.Name: ComponentOrganizationCode
Attribute.Description: Organization that maintains the catalog for the Component Item.

Attribute.Name: ComponentUnitOfMeasure
Attribute.Description: Unit of measure for the Component Item.

Description.div: Valid value is Delete . Set Operation = " Delete " to delete the entity. To add or modify a component there is no need to pass operation attribute. It is determined internally. Delete is the one which should be passed explicitly.
If Reset is passed as Y , the language descriptions change. If Reset is passed as N , only the deltas are applied.
If this element is passed, LocaleCode is a mandatory attribute. The LocaleCode is not validated. The information is stored in the YFS_LANGUAGE_DESCRIPTION table.
Valid value is Delete . Set Operation = " Delete " to delete the entity.

Defines the Tag Identifier and Tag Descriptor attributes for Tag Controlled Items.
If no Tag Identifier is specified and the item is tag controlled.

Specifies the activity to be performed for the item.
ActivityCode passed is not configured
ActivityCode is not passed

Attribute to specify the Sequence Number in which the Instruction should be performed.
ActivitySeqNo is not passed
Attribute to specify whether the Instruction should be added or deleted. If passed as Delete activity is deleted from the item else a new instruction is created.
Attribute to specify whether the Instruction should be added or deleted. If passed as Delete instruction is deleted else a new instruction is created.
If Reset is passed as Y , the old Asset records are removed and replaced with the new ones. If Reset is not passed or Reset is passed as N , only the deltas are applied.
The locale for which output should be returned in. Locale should be passed in the standard format of "language_country_variant" (e.g., "fr_FR", "en_US_CA", etc.).
Valid value is Delete . Set Operation = " Delete " to delete the entity.
Type of asset.
If Reset is passed as Y , the old records are removed and replaced with the new ones. If Reset is not passed or Reset is passed as N , only the deltas are applied.
Valid value is Delete . Set Operation = " Delete " to delete the entity.

WIPCostFactorPurpose element can be passed in for managing the cost factor purpose for a physical kit item. The values passed in this element are stored in YFS_COST_FACTOR_PURPOSE table if KitCode is PK, otherwise they are ignored. Cost_Factor_Purpose column in this table is stamped with a default value of WIP. CostFactorGroupKey must be passed in to update the cost factor purpose for the item. If not passed in, the cost factor purpose will get deleted for that item.
If Reset is passed as Y , the old records are removed and replaced with the new ones. If Reset is not passed or Reset is passed as N , only the deltas are applied.
Valid value is Delete . Set Operation = " Delete " to delete the entity.
Unique ID of the image in the external location.
Label of the image.
External location of the image.

CategoryAssociations element can create or remove association between categories to an item based on CategoryKey or CategoryPath. Although multiple categories can be associated to an Item, performance of manageItem has to be considered accordingly.
If IgnoreCategoryAssociationException is passed as Y , then exception scenarios are ignored. For e.g. item is already associated to a category and user is attempting to associate again.

Action to take
Valid Values:
Create - Creates a new association.
Delete - Deletes an existing association.
The default behavior is Create .
The primary key of YFS_CATEGORY table.
Contains the hierarchy or path of the category with respect to the category domain.
